Our team believes everyone should be treated with respect and fairness, no matter their body size or weight. We’re here to give you personalized care and help you feel comfortable.

elements.tooltip: Why do we ask: If Yes: Why do you take aspirin? (For example: prevention, previous heart attack or stents, after a stroke or TIA)

elements.name: prescribedMedications
elements.title: Please list all of your prescribed medications (including pills, injections, puffers), the dose you take and how often you take it.
elements.description:
It’s very important for us to know all the medications you take because some may need to be stopped before your surgery. This depends on the medication, why you’re taking it, and the type of surgery. We’ll let you know which medications to keep taking and which ones to stop.

elements.name: anyMedAllergy
elements.title: Are you allergic to any medications?
elements.description: It’s important for your healthcare team to know about your allergies and reactions so they can plan the safest care for you.
elements.tooltip:
If Yes:
1. Are you allergic to any of the following? Choose all that apply. 
- Ancef or cefazolin
- Propofol
- Succinylcholine
- Volatile anesthetics
- Rocuronium
- Other (text box)

2. Describe your reaction. (For example: rash, difficulty breathing, nausea/vomitting or unknown)
text box

Are you allergic to latex?
